{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3293312,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-24T17:37:04.859Z","cooked":"

My team has wired an regular AndyMark compressor to REV Pneumatics Hub. Iâ€™m copy-pasting some code I wrote last year, and making some small modifications

At the top of my Robot class I declared the Compressor

private Compressor compressor = new Compressor(PneumaticsModuleType.REVPH)

And then in robotInit() I enable the compressor

compressor.enableDigital()

however, as the title says, the compressor doesnâ€™t run.

I tried a few other things, like using PneumaticHub class instead, but Iâ€™ve had no success.

There must be a step that Iâ€™ve missed or done wrong. Any help is greatly appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-01-24T17:37:04.859Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":40,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":224.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":451847,"topic_slug":"compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on/451847/1","custom_user_title":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3293320,"name":"Drew Whisenant","username":"drewwhis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drewwhis/{size}/223564_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-24T17:47:09.026Z","cooked":"

Have you wired the pressure switch into the hub as well? I believe the system requires the switch by default. (In addition to the robot being enabled.)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-01-24T17:47:09.026Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":30.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":451847,"topic_slug":"compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on","display_username":"Drew Whisenant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38442,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"538AM, 10101M | FTA/FTAA/CSA"},"post_url":"/t/compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on/451847/2","custom_user_title":"538AM, 10101M | FTA/FTAA/CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3293328,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-24T17:57:40.189Z","cooked":"

Agreed with @drewwhis. The PH/PCM compressor control will default to off is the pressure switch input is open/disconnected.

If the switch isnâ€™t wired, you should definitely do that. But in the meantime, you can test it by manually shorting the switch pins together using a wire, 2-pin jumper, or pliers (but donâ€™t bend the pins).

If that still doesnt work, please share your code in full, preferably as a link to github or similar.

Iâ€™m not a very good electrician and Iâ€™ve never done pneumatics stuff. So Iâ€™ve uploaded some pictures of what our system looks like

IMG_20240124_1258341920Ã—1440 280 KB

I can upload more pictures if needed

From the pictures it looks like there is a Digital switch wired into the system currently. Itâ€™s easier to see where itâ€™s wired in the second picture. The switch itself is visible in the first picture.

IMG_20240124_125834~2711Ã—619 112 KB

My next suggestion would be to short the contacts on the switch with a screwdriver contacting both posts on the switch to see if it turns on after that. Same as jumping it without the switch put in.

Edit: ignore me. The reply below mine is correct

It looks like you donâ€™t have your PH wired into the CAN bus, so it isnâ€™t receiving signals!

Edit: refer here for details (section on CAN bus) - Wiring the Pneumatic Hub - ION Control System

IMG_20240124_1338571920Ã—2560 465 KB

We tried to wire the CAN, however I donâ€™t think weâ€™ve done this correctly, as we still cannot start the compressor

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-01-24T18:42:50.156Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":31.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":451847,"topic_slug":"compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/c/6/c6611b8cc5b76ea71ce22ca9458981e042d8da00.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38442,"username":"drewwhis","name":"Drew Whisenant","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drewwhis/{size}/223564_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on/451847/7","custom_user_title":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3293379,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-24T18:59:58.039Z","cooked":"

How are you terminating your CAN bus? it looks like you have something wired to it after the Power Distribution Panel. What position is the jumper on the PDP in?
Are you getting any CAN errors on the driver station?

With the robot enabled, have you tried jumping the switch pins on the PH or shorting the screw terminals on the pressure switch?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-01-24T19:53:29.617Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":10.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":451847,"topic_slug":"compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55649,"username":"manso","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on/451847/8","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3293412,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-24T19:42:58.818Z","cooked":"

Have you tried running the compressor in the Rev hardware client? That will verify the compressor itself and its wiring is okay.

As mentioned before, try shorting the leads on the pressure switch to ensure itâ€™s a closed connection.

Also goes without saying, make sure you enable the robot when testing out the compressor

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-01-24T19:42:58.818Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":451847,"topic_slug":"compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/compressor-on-rev-pneumatics-hub-wont-turn-on/451847/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3293579,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-24T21:50:52.319Z","cooked":"

Thanks so much for your suggestion!

I booted up the REV Hardware client and connected to the PCM via USB-C, it turns out there was some misconfiguration and an incorrect CAN ID, I have fixed those errors and everything works as expected now!
